oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter to George Washington Campbell from John Coffee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A one page letter written on May 8, 1814 and sent from Huntsville, Alabama. Coffee notes the vast amount and the value of country newly acquired as a result of the conquest of the Creek nation. He offers his services as a surveyor to lay out and survey these new lands.
Coffee surveyed the lands acquired by the U.S. after the Ceek War (1813-1814). He relocated to Alabama where he became a wealthy land-owner.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Dyas Collection of John Coffee Papers
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Campbell, George Washington, 1769-1848;Coffee, John, 1772-1833;Creek War, 1813-1814;United States. Indian Removal Act of 1830;Legislators--United States
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Coffee, John, 1772-1833
